revised_title: Establishing the A.R.C. Institute of Animal Physiology at Babraham
tldr: The article discusses the establishment of the A.R.C. Institute of Animal Physiology at Babraham, Cambridge, and its departments of Physiology, Biochemistry, and Experimental Pathology. The Institute aimed to improve knowledge of the fundamental physiology of farm animals and provide facilities for research. The text describes the development of the Institute, its staff, and the research conducted in various fields, including autonomic system studies, cardiac output measurements, and absorption of metabolites in the rumen.
